name: mcp
readme:
# MCP Proxy Monorepo

This monorepo contains MCP (Model Control Protocol) servers for different services.

## Server URI
`https://mcp.bitte.ai/sse`

## Add to Curser Settings
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "bitte-ai": {
      "url": "https://mcp.bitte.ai/sse"
    }
  }
}
```


## Packages

- **bitte-ai**: MCP server for Bitte AI integrations

## Setup

To install dependencies:

```bash
bun install
```

## Development

This project uses Turborepo for managing the monorepo workflow and Biome for code quality tools.

### Build all packages

```bash
bun run build
```

### Start both services

```bash
bun run start
```

### Development mode

```bash
bun run dev
```

### Format and lint your code

```bash
bun run check
# To fix automatically:
bun run check:fix
```

### Run individual services

```bash
# Run bitte-ai service
bun run dev:bitte-ai
```

## Adding a new package

1. Create a new directory in the `packages` folder
2. Add the necessary package.json, tsconfig.json, and implementation files
3. Update the root package.json and tsconfig.json to include your new package

This project uses [Bun](https://bun.sh) as the JavaScript runtime.

For more information: [Vibestreaming Logs](https://github.com/microchipgnu/vibestream)
rawDependencies:
=== package.json ===
{
  "name": "mcp-proxy",
  "private": true,
  "workspaces": ["packages/*", "apps/*"],
  "type": "module",
  "packageManager": "bun@1.2.1",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@biomejs/biome": "^1.9.4",
    "@types/bun": "latest",
    "turbo": "^2.4.4",
    "typescript": "^5.0.0"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "turbo dev",
    "build": "turbo build",
    "start": "turbo start",
    "check": "biome check",
    "check:fix": "biome check --write",
    "start:all": "bun run ./scripts/start-dev.ts",
    "docker:up": "bun run ./scripts/start-all.ts",
    "docker:down": "bun run ./scripts/docker-down.ts"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "concurrently": "^8.2.2"
  }
}
